formalpara.title: SIZE_MIN and SIZE_MAX
formalpara.para: SIZE_MAX is now correctly defined in stdint.h to be an unsigned quantity equal to the maximum possible value of a size_t, as required by the C standard. In addition, the definition of SIZE_MIN has been removed, as this constant is not prescribed by the C standard.

formalpara.title: ColdFire ROM script error
formalpara.para: A syntax error is fixed that prevented the ColdFire ROM scripts working for systems with ColdFire Flash Modules.

formalpara.title: VFP initialization code
formalpara.para: &csl_sgxx; now includes startup code to enable VFP coprocessors. This can be selected with -T rdimonvfp-ram.ld.

formalpara.title: Improved memcpy and memset
formalpara.para: memcpy and memset have been optimized for better performance.

formalpara.title: Execution order of .fini_array entries
formalpara.para: For ELF targets using .init_array and .fini_array sections, the functions whose addresses are stored in .fini_array are now run in reverse order (i.e., the last function in the array is run first), as required by the ELF specification. Previous releases ran the entries in forward order (i.e., the first function in the array was run first).

formalpara.title: Using internal SRAM
formalpara.para: The linker scripts now define additional memory regions such as .RAMBAR. Objects can be placed in these regions by using the __attribute__ ((section(".RAMBAR"))) attribute. Program start up initializes the contents of these regions.

formalpara.title: Linker scripts
formalpara.para: Board linker scripts are now only placed in the default multilib directory, or the multilib directory for the board in question. Therefore if you use an incorrect -mcpu option when compiling, you will get a link error rather than a program that will not run on your target board.

formalpara.title: Handling of out-of-range values by strtof
formalpara.para: The strtof function now sets errno to ERANGE when the input is not representable as a float, as required by the ISO C standard.

formalpara.title: New board support
formalpara.para: Support has been added for Cobra52235, Cobra5272, Cobra5282, Cobra5329, Cobra5475 and Cobra5485 boards.

formalpara.title: Semihosting compatibility improvements
formalpara.para: The semihosting I/O implementation has been improved to work with a wider range of simulators and host implementations.
